20001001.text:
(There's one catch... my opponent is my old friend <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</>!
Either way, I'll do my best to win!)

20001002.text:
(Various weapons have been prepared for the finalists.
Let's see what we've got here.)

20001009.text:
(There are more options than I expected.
I'd better try them out and choose the one that feels right.)

20001011.text:
We're no one important.
We only entered the Championship for the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>.

20001012.text:
<myHero.name/> is unmistakably a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</>.
We can't just keep silent after what we just witnessed.

20001013.text: I've known this person for ages. I can vouch for them. <myHero.name/> isn't dangerous.

20001014.text: Ha! Surely you're kidding? Why should I simply take your word for it?

20001015.text: Well, if you won't listen, I'll give you this as collateral.

20001016.text:
I'll prove to you that <myHero.name/> is not dangerous.
Until then, you can hold onto this for me.

20001017.text: Hmm... all right. I'll let you off the hook.

20001019.text: Hold up. I never said you could leave.

20001021.text:
If you really want to prove that <myHero.name/> isn't dangerous,
you should at the very least take <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>responsibility</> for ruining the Championship.

20001022.text:
The Martial Arts Championship was held to appease the citizens troubled by the
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>war against the Sura</>. There's a lot of money, time, and effort at stake here.

20001023.text:
But you ruined all that.
We even wasted precious Caelite.

20001024.text:
Not to mention the power that you used... that's a Sura's power.
I don't know who you are, but we'd be foolish to let you walk around freely. Understand?

20001025.text:
But... Since Aran gave me his Holy Relic as collateral to vouch for you...
I should at least give you a chance.

20001026.text:
In light of that, if you clean up after the mess that you've made, I'll let you go. 
I'll even give his <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Holy Relic</> back to him. How does that sound? I think we can come to an agreement.

20001028.text: All right, you're a smart one. That makes things a lot easier.

20001029.text:
Go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>New Fishbelly Pub</> and find the Edeta Member named <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Doha</>.
She'll tell you what to do next.

20001030.text:
Oh, and by the way... Don't even think about running.
The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Edeta Clan</>'s influence is greater than you might think. You can't hide from us.

20001033.text: (Eh? What's this? A Baron is calling me.)

20001034.text:
You look like you're looking fur some help!
My name is Dondon, an agent from the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Soul Bridge</>. I'm here to tell you about Souls, meow!

20001035.text: I know a bit about Souls. I did save a Bulbari's Soul from a Hollow...

20001036.text:
Oooh, you already know about the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Souls</>, huh? That makes things easier, purr.
You know how incredible the Souls are, right? You can meet them through <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Soul Scrolls</>.

20001037.text:
Here, I'll give you a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Soul Scroll</>!
Try using this Scroll to summon your vewy own personal Soul, meow!

20001038.text: There are many different Souls you can summon with the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Soul Scroll</>, meow!

20001039.text: You can utilize the power of the Soul you summoned right away, so try it out, purr.

20001040.text:
By the way... What are you wearing? Geez... Here, put this on instead, meow.
You're not going to last long here looking like that.

20001041.text:
Now, if you have questions, come to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Soul Bridge</> at Moonwater Harbor.
I'm off fur the day now. Bye, meow!

20001042.text: I've heard about you from Clan leader Harum.

20001043.text:
There are four pillars that uphold this year's Martial Arts Championship. They are called the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</>, or the four saberfangs:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]><textColor=[78:148:215:255]>the Plum Blossom, the Soul Bridge, the Peach Blossom, and the Soul Steel</></>. You need to acquire a Plaque of Merit from each of them.

20001044.text:
You must meet with their respective Chiefs and offer them your assistance.
In return, they will give you a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plaque of Merit</>. This implies that you've wiped your slate clean.

20001045.text:
I've heard that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>you can obtain the plaques</> without involving those individual groups.
Either way, I don't care how you get them.

20001046.text:
Once you get all four Plaques of Merit, come find me at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Fisher's Village</>. 
I bid you good fortune.

20001047.text: So, you talked to Doha. What did he say you should do?

20001048.text: He said I'll have to meet the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</> first.

20001049.text: I've heard of them. But do you even know where they are?

20001050.text: Saho? Are you looking fur the Saho, meow?

20001051.text:
Oh, it's you, Dondon.
I just remembered that the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Soul Bridge</> is also a part of the Saho.

20001052.text: You're right! Ahem! And I'm a member of that vewy Soul Bridge, meow!

20001053.text: That's great! I should consult with the Soul Bridge leader, then. Where should I go to meet your Chief?

20001054.text: All the Saho Chiefs are at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor Square</> right now, so just use Windstride to get there, purr!

20001056.text:
Oh! You don't know about <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Windstride</>?
You can go anywhere you want if you use Windstride, meow!

20001057.text: Open the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Map</> and use Windstride, and you can get to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor Square</>, where the Saho are, right away!

20001058.text: Amazing, isn't it? That's not all, purr!

20001059.text:
Wah! Who are you? You startled me, mrrw! Huh? You've learned Windstride from Dondon, huh?
Nice to meet you, purr! I'm Dundun. Dondon and I are twins!

20001060.text: The Saho you're looking for are on the south side of the square. But... why do you want to see them?

20001061.text: It's because I need their Plaque of Merit.

20001062.text: Sorry, but aren't you too weak for that? You don't even have a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Patron</>, mrrow?

20001063.text: I learned about Souls from Dondon, but what's a Patron?

20001064.text:
Don't you know what Patrons are? This is why I'm here—to advertise them, purr!
Here, take this. It's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Patron Scroll</>, proudly created by Soul Bridge!

20001065.text: It's better to see it fur yourself. Try using the Patron Scroll, meow!

20001066.text: What do you say, meow? That Patron will pwotect you against everything!

20001067.text:
Come to the Soul Bridge, and you can buy tons of stuff!
That includes Patron Scrolls, Soul Scrolls and much, much more, meow! So, don't furget to come by!

20001068.text:
Oh, right! You already know how to use <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Windstride</>, right?
Dondon is an amateur, so don't rely on him. Use Windstride fur yourself, meow.

20001069.text:
Now then, the Saho should be at the Moonwater Harbor Square, so you should go!
The square is right over there. Just walk on over, meow.

20001071.text: Well, it's kind of a long story...

20001072.text:
I see. Well, you made it here and that's all that matters.
This is the Saho. Since you were late to the party, I already told them about you.

20001074.text:
I've heard about you from Aran. Though it's a shame that the Championship was ruined, I won't say any more than I need to.
Clan Edeta apologizes about this on your behalf, and they've got more at stake.

20001075.text:
But in order to receive our Plaque of Merit, you need to accept our conditions.
If you carry them out, we'll award you the plaque.

20001077.text:
By the way, I'm sorry. I got you into this mess...
If it weren't for that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Herbalist Old Man</> telling me that the Caelite was here, I wouldn't have...

20001079.text:
Ah, never mind. I can get my Heavenly Sword returned.
I was under the impression that being a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn Advocate</> would rarely be that useful to me, but thank the spirits I was wrong.

20001082.text: What do you mean by that?

20001083.text:
As you know, I can't tell anyone that I'm a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn Advocate</>.
You only found out because that Herbalist Old Man made a slip of the tongue...

20001084.text: Every Advocate has their own unique <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Holy Relic</>. <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>True Sacrifice</> is my Holy Relic.

20001085.text: Doesn't that make it even more important?

20001086.text:
Yeah. It does.
That's why we should solve this as soon as possible.

20001091.text:
I want you to check in on the Soul Bridge herbalists.
As you can tell, I'm here on some very important business, so I can't just leave, furr.

20001092.text:
The herbalists went to get some rare herbs by the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>southwestern wreckage</>, but they haven't returned...
I believe they might be on the opposite side of the Moonwater Harbor's western cliffside road, but getting there won't be easy, furr.

20001093.text:
Tell me when you're ready.
I'll <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teleport</> you to the wreckage entrance. Furr!

20001095.text:
You want to know if this will make you dizzy?
What do you take the Soul Bridge Chief Furlong for? Furr.

20001097.text: Are you a Soul Bridge herbalist?

20001098.text: Yes, that's right! Even though I was able to get away, my fwiends are still back at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>wreckage</>, meow!

20001099.text: What happened exactly? Why are you so scared?

20001100.text:
Sniff... These <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scary blue-skinned pirates</> attacked us out of nowhere!
We were just minding our business collecting herbs, but they tried to hurt us, meow...

20001101.text:
Don't worry! We'll save your friends!
They're by the wreckage, right?

20001102.text:
Yes... thank you so much.
I'm going to be so sad if my friends get hurt... I'll leave it in your hands... Mrrow...

20001103.text:
Hm. This is a pretty strange <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>scroll</>.
I'll just take it with me for now.

20001106.text: Those must be the herbalists! Let's head over!

20001107.text: Thank you so much! My fwiends are safe thanks to you, meow!

20001108.text: We found this <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>scroll</>. Does it belong to the Soul Bridge?

20001109.text:
Huh? This doesn't seem to be ours.
But <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Furlong</> might know something about it, meow!

20001110.text: Oh, right... may I ask you fur one more favor, meow?

20001111.text: There is an extremely rare herb called the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Halfmoon Herb</> somewhere near the wreckage. We actually came here for that, mrrow...

20001112.text: But I just got so startled that now my legs feel like jelly, meow...

20001113.text: Don't worry! We just need to get some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Halfmoon Herb</> from over there, right? Leave it to us!

20001115.text: Wow! Thank you so much, meow!

20001116.text:
We'll stay behind and collect some more herbs in these safer areas.
Tell Furlong that we're safe and sound, meow!

20001117.text: Furlong should be back at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Soul Bridge</>by now, meow!

20001118.text:
We're just herbalists, but we can also help you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teleport</>!
We'll combine our powers to teleport you there, meow!

20001119.text: Meowowow, off you go, meow wow!

20001120.text: We rescued the Soul Bridge herbalists from the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blueskin</>.

20001121.text: Furr! Thank you so much! You've helped out a bunch!

20001122.text:
Ah, I came across <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>this parchment</> by chance.
Is this related to <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>?

20001123.text: What? <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>? Hm... Maka... ra...?! Furr... I never expected this to happen...!

20001124.text:
I'll take this paper with me. Now, here's your <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plaque of Merit</> as I promised.
And Mehwa here has also come to visit because she has a request for you.

20001127.text:
Aerin went through a lot of trouble cleaning up after your mess in the championship.
Because of that, she's even behind on her own work.

20001128.text: Ah, then we just need to help her out, right? We understand!

20001129.text:
Seek out <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hayon</> at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Plum Blossom Base</>.
She will fill you in on what you guys need to do.

20001130.text:
Ahem! Now, listen up!
As of this moment, all activities within Moonwater Harbor will be considered illegal unless they're approved by me, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]><textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</></>.

20001131.text:
Also, any complaint, refutation, and refusal
to cooperate will be deemed an overt challenge to my authority as the Fishbelly Pub Owner.

20001132.text:
What? Is he crazy? He can't tell us we're <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>banned from all activities</> without telling us ahead of time!
Gah, the shop owner is going to hit the roof—again!

20001135.text:
I know. And it hasn't been that long since the last time he did this.
The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Saho</> aren't going to make this easy.

20001136.text: (This place must be where to find the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Plum Blossom</>.)

20001138.text: I came to fill in for Aerin and relay Mehwa's instructions.

20001139.text:
So, you guys are the culprits behind the Martial Arts Championship incident.
I still don't trust you completely, but... beggars can't be choosers.

20001140.text: Aerin was investigating a robbery at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Carpenter's Quarters</>.

20001141.text:
As the carpenter was away learning his craft, a thief came and robbed his house.
The strange thing is, he didn't steal anything valuable. All he stole was <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>food</>.

20001142.text: Go investigate the Carpenter's Quarters <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>North of the Sapphire Basin</>.

20001143.text: (This must be the Carpenter's Quarters that had been broken into recently.)

20001144.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, look!
There are strange footprints all over the ground outside the cabin!

20001145.text: (They don't look like they belong to a person.)

20001146.text: These look as if they're <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>footprints made by a rat</>?

20001147.text: (Rats aren't this big, are they? I should follow the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>footprints</>.)

20001148.text: (It looks like the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen</> stole the supplies.)

20001150.text: (The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen camp</> should be around here somewhere.)

20001151.text: (I had better clear out this camp.)

20001152.text: How dare a Ratman steal from a person's house... that's completely out of line.

20001153.text: I'm pretty sure <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>someone else put them up</> to it. I'll investigate it myself.

20001154.text: Aerin was also in charge of tracking down a cargo chest that was misdelivered.

20001155.text: The cargo chest in question was delivered to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Lakeside House</> by mistake.

20001156.text: Please track it down. Come to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>New Fishbelly Pub</> once you do.

20001158.text: Hey, there's something in front of the house.

20001159.text: (It must be the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>misdelivered cargo</> that Hayon was talking about.)

20001160.text: It's surrounded by <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>ominous-looking stains</> of some kind.

20001161.text: I have a bad feeling about this... let's take a look inside the chest for now.

20001165.text: I've never heard of a monster like that roaming <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>these parts</>.

20001166.text: Who in the world would send such a dangerous <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>monster</> as cargo?

20001167.text: I'd better bring the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plum Blossoms</> to tend to the fallen owner of the house.

20001168.text: I saw <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> fleeing the area where someone was attacked by a monster.

20001169.text:
You say that you saw <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> running away from the Lakeside House?
That sounds like him.

20001170.text:
The owner of the Lakeside House was a community leader who supported both the Plum Blossom and the Saho.
How dare they even think about hurting him? I'm at a loss for words.

20001171.text:
I never expected he'd do something so evil. I heard he lost a fortune from the Martial Arts Championship bets.
But to stoop so low as to resort to such awful deeds... This <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> has crossed the line!

20001172.text:
Don't worry, our recruits should've rescued the injured house owner by now.
You can leave the rest to us. Ah, and here's the Plaque of Merit I promised. Good job.

20001176.text:
Hey, we've met before, haven't we? I also have something to request of you.
I haven't heard anything from our shop's <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Cargo Carriage</> for days now.

20001177.text:
I'm worried because we had a carriage disappear <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>last week</>.
I've dispatched an <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>employee</> to investigate, but... Ahem. He's still kind of a rookie.

20001178.text:
If you help him, you'll be helping us.
You'll find <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Yuok</> by the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>bend in the road</> just west of here.

20001180.text: I'm here to offer assistance as per <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Horyong</>'s request.

20001181.text: Spirits. Why did he have to send someone when I'm perfectly capable alone?

20001182.text: You look like you're in a tight spot, by the looks of it. We'll help you out. Tell us what's going on.

20001183.text:
Tsk... It's just... The merchant carriage was ambushed by some <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Thiefhogs</>!
They just had to target the carriage I'm in charge of!

20001184.text: To make matters worse, these runts took off with all of our cargo!

20001185.text: Ah! They couldn't have gone far, so can you please retrieve the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>cargo</> for me?

20001187.text: Awesome! Thanks a bunch! We got everything back in one piece!

20001188.text:
Huh? This isn't part of our inventory... hm? This, too.
Would you look at that. They stole from a lot of different merchants!

20001189.text: I heard the Peach Blossom lost a carriage <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>last week</>, too.

20001190.text:
Really? Last week as well? The <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>guards</> must be losing control over that area.
I'm going to bring this cargo to the Moonwater Harbor first.

20001191.text:
Can you check on the guards for me? 
You'll be able to come up on their <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>post</> if you follow this road.

20001192.text: Come see me at that <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>big pine tree</> when you're done!

20001193.text: So, there was an incident concerning the Peach Blossom carriage...

20001194.text:
We've heard that these attacks have become a common occurrence recently...
Do the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>guards</> know anything about this?

20001195.text: Who are you guys? Hm? I...

20001196.text: Ahem... Suddenly, I just remembered I'm a bit preoccupied right now.

20001199.text: Why are you being so persistent?!

20001200.text: You keep dodging us. Got something to hide?

20001201.text: What are you on about? I'll beat some sense into you troublemakers!

20001202.text: Whew... Well, that takes care of that.

20001203.text: Hm? What's this? A <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>strange scroll</> is over here on the ground.

20001204.text: (It's a precept requiring the guards to reduce their intervals and patrols.)

20001205.text: Hm... seems like someone is trying to undermine the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>guards</> here.

20001207.text: I guess we'll just have to ask them personally.

20001209.text: Who exactly is trying to undermine your authority? Spit it out!

20001210.text:
Gasp! This is...
Ahh... I'm so sorry...

20001211.text:
We had no choice but to carry out these <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>orders from the superiors</>...
Please, forgive us. We'll reinforce the patrols immediately...

20001212.text:
Superiors? Who is in <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>charge of the guards</>?
We'll hold onto this precept for the time being. Reinforce the patrols immediately.

20001213.text: You should know about what happened at the guard post. Here's the precept.

20001214.text:
That's the precept?... I don't believe this!
You've gone above and beyond what I expected. Thank you! I'll take care of the rest!

20001215.text: Well done. Now, here's the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plaque of Merit</> that my father promised to you!

20001216.text:
(She's Horyong's daughter...
Figures, since they do have the same fighting spirit.)

20001217.text:
Well then, I'm off to report back to my father.
I almost forgot, Moonwind is also here because he had a favor to ask you!

20001220.text:
I came because I wanted to ask you personally!
I usually take care of the businesses in the shipyard. My old buddy Steel Fist takes care of matters related to the blacksmith.

20001221.text:
But I've heard that the materials the blacksmith asked for haven't arrived yet. 
We'll have to use the crystals from the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Lake Turtles</> around the Turtle Lake for now.

20001222.text:
When you've got enough, bring them over to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Steel Fist</>.
He'll be around at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Turtle Lake</>, gathering the materials.

20001227.text: I'm here to gather Turtle Crystals upon <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonwind</>'s request.

20001228.text: Oh! If Moonwind put you up to it... ahem.

20001230.text:
Did Moonwind say anything else?
Like... Asking me to be careful, or something like that...?

20001231.text: I assure you, she didn't say that.

20001232.text:
Ah... Anyway, I'm glad you guys are here! 
I'm going to need you to go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Cargo House</>.

20001233.text:
I heard the materials we wanted arrived, but it doesn't seem like they'll release them any time soon!
It'll only make things worse if I go down there, so check up on it for me!

20001235.text: Ugh, what is it? I said I don't know!

20001236.text: Why the hell are you yelling at us?

20001237.text: I said I don't know! Shoo! Go away!

20001239.text: The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>owner</> is really getting on my nerves...

20001240.text: Tell me about it. Is the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>chest</> left here by the owner safe and sound?

20001241.text:
Of course! Take a look at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>special storage area</> over there.
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>mercenaries</> that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Makara</> sent us are guarding it.

20001242.text: What did we do to deserve this? Those things are taking up all the space we have.

20001243.text: You're right. We'll barely have any room to stand on if this goes on any longer...

20001244.text: I wonder what's in that chest. It's protected by so many guards.

20001245.text: That must be it. Let's check it out.

20001246.text:
It says that all materials to be delivered to the Soul Steel must be held for three days before being sent out.
...Oh, there's also that suspicious drink I had! There's a paper here explaining how to drink it!

20001247.text:
So, this is the nourishing tonic that you mentioned before? Perhaps the mercenary captain drank this, too?
But... is this stuff really safe to drink? It's sealed, and it still smells so bad...

20001248.text:
Anyway, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> wasn't even trying to hide that he was interfering with the Soul Steel's work.
We should return to Steel Fist with that letter and the drink.

20001249.text: You'd better take care of the issues over at the Cargo House. Take a look at this <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>letter</> from <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Makara</>.

20001250.text: What? Something like this was happening behind our backs?!

20001251.text: <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>, you jerk... How dare he mess with <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>my Moonwind</>!?

20001253.text:
Ah! I meant <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>our Soul Steel</>!
Anyway, here's your <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>plaque</> as I promised. Now we're even, aren't we?

20001254.text: Do you, uh, have a crush on your clan leader...?

20001255.text: What are you talking about? Take the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plaque of Merit</> and get out of my sight!

20001256.text:
Squeak squeak. Yeah, you.
What are you looking for, squeak?

20001257.text: I'm trying to get the<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Fish Network's Plaque of Merit</>.

20001258.text:
Oh! You're here right on time.
I'm actually selling that very Plaque of Merit!

20001259.text:
Huh? How?
Are you someone of worth in the Sapphire Basin? Sounds fishy, if you ask me.

20001260.text:
Squeak squeak! No! It's not like that!
I deal under the table. I do charge a high price, but I vouch for the authenticity!

20001261.text:
If you don't want to run around and work for <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>the Saho</> in exchange for the plaques,
you can always come to me and buy them, squeak!

20001262.text:
Well, they did say I just had to bring them the plaques.
Buying one doesn't seem like a bad idea.

20001263.text: That's right! There's only one since it's so rare, so it will save you time, squeak!

20001267.text: I see Harum and the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Edeta</> over there.

20001268.text: You're right. You did well to collect these <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>plaques</>.

20001269.text: Let's go and prove to them that you're not dangerous!

20001270.text:
Sounds like you're finished. 
Have you brought me all the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Plaques of Merit</> I requested?

20001271.text: Here they are, the Plaques of Merit.

20001272.text: One, two... I've confirmed all four of them.

20001273.text: This is a good start. Would you two come with me? I've got something to tell you.

20001274.text: You should wait here. This won't take long.

20001277.text: You sure handed it back over easily. Why did I bother offering it to you in the first place?

20001278.text: I can always take it back if you want.

20001279.text: No thanks. But why did you give it back to me so easily?

20001280.text:
That's because I know who you are.
It's been a while, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Shiro</>.

20001281.text: How do you... wait, are you?

20001283.text: Whoa! Nice to meet you! You're also a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn Advocate</>... What a coincidence!

20001284.text:
Ah, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> is fine.
They know about it, anyway. The Herbalist Old Man told me that it's okay to share it.

20001285.text: Herbalist Old Man? Are you talking about <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Old Man Cho</>?

20001286.text: Anyway! Who are you reincarnated from? My guess is <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Parsha</>.

20001288.text:
Ha! I knew it. The Edeta Clan was <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>created by Parsha</> in the first place.
I guess it's to be expected. But, to think I would meet you here... This is one heck of a coincidence!

20001289.text:
Haha, you're right. By the way, I heard a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Blue Caelite</> has been found in the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Barren Ruins</>.
Maybe you should go check it out? You entered the Martial Arts Championship for the Caelite, after all.

20001290.text: Really? That's great news. I'll head for the Barren Ruins and check if there really is any <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>.

20001291.text: No, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> still has some things to do.

20001292.text: Huh? Why? Can't you let <myHero.name/> off the hook for me?

20001293.text: Aran, I can't do that even if the request comes from you. You have to understand the position I'm in.

20001294.text: All right, fine. No use asking the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>principle-abiding Parsha</> for a favor... What does <myHero.name/> need to do?

20001295.text:
We've encountered problems at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Bottomless Pit</> after the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Portal</> opened during the Martial Arts Championship.
It also caused the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hollows</> to become enraged...

20001296.text:
Can you head over there and deal with them?
Once you do, we'll forget all about what happened during the Martial Arts Championship.

20001298.text:
Okay, you'll be able to get the finer details from Orum.
I'll meet you back at the designated meeting site.

20001299.text: So, what now? I'm heading out to find some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>. Do you want to come with me?

20001300.text:
If you want to go together, meet me at the southeastern <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Barren Ruins</>.
You can get there quickly by using Windstride.

20001301.text: I'll follow you after I hear about the next quest from Orum.

20001302.text:
Harum told me the details.
You'll find me at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Bottomless Pit</>, which is northwest of our current location.

20001303.text: I'll wait for you there. When you're ready, please use Windstride to come to me.

20001304.text: I'll go as soon as I'm ready.

20001305.text: Are you going to take the Plaques of Merit I brought?

20001306.text:
Ah, we only asked you to get them, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, because we wanted to test your abilities. We don't actually need them.
I heard that someone at the New Fishbelly Pub <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>trades the Plaques for something useful</>.

20001308.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>! Get over here! There's an <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Awakened Corridor</>!

20001310.text:
Ah, you've never seen it for yourself, have you? Remember how the Herbalist Old Man said this was a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>test ground for Advocates</>? 
You can grow stronger by overcoming challenges or defeating others...

20001311.text: Yeah, I remember the gist of it.

20001312.text:
Haha, you don't need to force yourself to remember. 
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Normal people</> can't enter this place, anyway.

20001313.text: So that means that I can't enter?

20001314.text:
Ah, I guess so. My bad... why don't you wait right here?
I'll be right back, all right?

20001315.text: (Can I open that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>door</>? I'd better go take a closer look.)

20001317.text: Huh? What happened? Did you pass through the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Awakened Corridor</>, too?

20001319.text:
Right? It's just as I thought. I knew there was something about you. 
I just couldn't put my finger on it. I don't remember you being one of the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Advocates</>...

20001320.text: Ah, whatever. We'll know sooner or later as we look for the Caelite.

20001322.text:
No, not yet. I think we're going to have to look around a bit longer. Would you mind helping me? 
You saw some Caelite that reacts to me at the Martial Arts Championship.

20001323.text:
I saw that the Barons set up <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>camp</> over there. Why don't you ask them?
Meanwhile, I'll take a look around.

20001324.text: What's up? I'm Naypaw, the leader of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron Pioneers</>, meow!

20001325.text: Did you see something emitting a blue light?

20001326.text:
You mean that shiny blue stone?
We saw a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Protector</> holding something like that, meow!

20001328.text: Meow... I don't know which one...

20001329.text: Just kill all of them and you'll find it sooner or later, meow.

20001331.text: (Um... but it doesn't look like Caelite...)

20001332.text: (Man, I think we've been had. Let's take a look <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>deeper inside</>.)

20001333.text: (Oh! I think I see something shiny on the ground there!)

20001335.text: (I can hear some <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>strange noises</> from behind me, and it's creeping me out.)

20001338.text: Whoa! What's going on? <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, you okay?

20001340.text:
Whew... What just happened?
Let's see... If we found what I have been looking for.

20001341.text:
I don't think this is it.
Hm... Doesn't seem like <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Shiro's Caelite</> is here. Matter of fact, I don't see any Caelite here.

20001343.text: Ah? Have I never explained it to you before? Where... should I begin...

20001346.text:
No! Not at all. Caelite is...
Well, to put it simply, it is the physical manifestation of an <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Advocate's energy</>.

20001347.text:
Most people tend to mistake it as a normal gem, but
Advocates or Reborn Ones can draw immense power from them.

20001348.text:
These gems also hold key memories of their life as an Advocate,
so when a Reborn One absorbs one, they remember a bit of their <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>past</>.

20001349.text: Is that why you're looking for it?

20001350.text:
Yeah. But we can't just absorb any Caelite.
A Reborn One must absorb the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite they left behind</> when they were an Advocate.

20001351.text:
It would be better to say that we're regaining our power.
And for me, I seek out Shiro's Caelite. My Caelite emits a blue light.

20001352.text:
I'm going to look below us. Can you look on the ridge above us?
And be careful, as the Protectors have become enraged.

20001353.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, are you okay? I think you absorbed Noi's Caelite.
But... Why did <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Noi's Caelite</> react to you? How?

20001355.text:
As you know, you're not a Reborn One.
And like I explained, these Caelite contain memories that only their matching <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn Advocates</> can reclaim.

20001356.text:
But you just absorbed Noi's Caelite... How are you able to see her memories? Hm... I don't know.
But since it's come to this, you should look for <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Noi's Caelite</>.

20001357.text:
The more you find, the more you'll remember.
Then we may come to understand why Noi's Caelite is reacting to you, right?

20001359.text: All right. What did you see just now?

20001360.text: I saw Noi and Parsha having a conversation...

20001361.text:
Ah... That must be during the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Cataclysm</>...
Noi was the Protector of Life while Parsha was the Advocate of Order. They were best friends.

20001363.text: Yeah, I think so. Oh, you're right. Why don't you try asking Harum about it?

20001364.text: I'll ask Harum as soon as I finish my quest at the Bottomless Pit.

20001365.text:
Head over to Harum as soon as you're done. 
I'll spend a bit more time looking for <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>my Caelite</> before joining you there. See you later!

20001366.text: Welcome. I've been waiting for you.

20001367.text: What do I need to do?

20001369.text:
The Fishbelly Pub used to be located here,
but with the sudden appearance of the Fissure, this place has become completely uninhabitable.

20001370.text:
However, the event at the Martial Arts Championship has had an effect on the Fissure as well.
I wouldn't find it strange if even the Sura started to emerge...

20001371.text: But for now, all we can do is whittle down these Hollows' numbers.

20001372.text: So, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, all you need to do is defeat these Hollows and bring me their cores.

20001373.text: Hello. I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kunale's assistant</> Josahun. It's nice to meet you. How can I help you?

20001374.text: How can I extract a Hollow's core?

20001375.text: First of all, these are <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hollow</>'s cores, which drop when you defeat them.

20001376.text: I'm not sure you can defeat the Hollows in the center of the Pit with your skills, though.

20001378.text:
You can obtain cores from the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Weakened Hollows</> nearby, so eliminate them.
It would be of great help if you could reduce their numbers.

20001380.text: Seems like you finished. Good job.

20001381.text: Why are the Edeta guarding this place?

20001382.text:
You want to know why the Edeta Clan is here? 
That's because the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Fissure</> is here.

20001383.text:
Our Edeta Clan was founded for the sole purpose of slaying the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</>. 
That's why we're serving the people by exterminating the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hollows</> here.

20001384.text:
In addition, the Edeta Clan has set up camp<textColor=[110:216:175:255]>all across the continent</>.
Wherever the Sura is, we're right behind them.

20001385.text: Your goal is noble and just.

20001386.text:
It is the will of our clan's founder, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Advocate Parsha</>. 
Normal beings like us will never be able to match Parsha's intelligence.

20001387.text:
To cut to the chase, go meet Harum <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>behind the tent</> after you're done.
Good luck.

20001388.text:
Did the Amplify go well? It'll be really useful to you.
Come to think of it, there's one more thing you should know.

20001389.text: (I should head over and tell her I've finished the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>task</>.)

20001390.text:
I heard from Orum. I heard you went above and beyond what we asked for.
Good work. As promised, we won't blame you for the Martial Arts Championship and the Sura incident.

20001391.text: I want to know more about the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>memory</>I saw in Noi's Caelite.

20001392.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Parsha</> and <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Noi</>? It was common knowledge that those two were extremely close. Even the common folk knew about it. 
Well, it would be more accurate to say that Parsha liked Noi a lot.

20001393.text: Why do you sound as if it's none of your business?

20001394.text:
Hm? Ah, well... Even though I'm Parsha's Reborn, I haven't found all my old <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>memories</> yet...
Hmm. Why do you ask?

20001395.text: (My <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Mother's Memento</>... There's a faint light emanating from the crescent moon-shaped jade.)

20001396.text: That's Noi's Holy Relic... are you Noi's Reborn?!

20001398.text: You're not? Then how is Noi's Holy Relic reacting to you?

20001399.text:
If the Holy Relic reacts to you, it means that you can use Noi's powers too...
Are you able to absorb Noi's Caelite as well?

20001401.text: I don't believe it... if that's true... that's great! Wait, come with me for a second.

20001403.text:
I know a place that holds <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Noi's Caelite</>. 
I thought that if you absorbed it, you might be able to know what's going on.

20001404.text: We should wait until Aran gets here.

20001405.text:
No, you should hurry. I'll have <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> bring Orum.
You should go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Deep Forest Graveyard</> with me right now.

20001406.text: (The place is overrun with Spiders and Dokkaebi Fire.)

20001407.text:
(I'll clean this place out a bit
as I head deeper inside.)

20001408.text: Over here. The Caelite is <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>inside</> here.

20001409.text: Once you absorb the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>, we'll be able to find out what's going on.

20001410.text: (Whew, we finally defeated it. Where did that come from?)

20001412.text:
Tomo never reacted to me no matter how hard I tried.
But things might be different with you. Go take a closer look.

20001413.text: You're not going to believe what happened to me... (...)

20001414.text: To think, everything that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>little kid</> said was true... I'm going to have to thank him later.

20001416.text:
I guess that show-off was good for something. 
By the way, thank the spirits that everything turned out okay. To think the Edeta's Leader was a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Faithbearer</>...

20001417.text: Isn't a Faithbearer a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>subordinate of the Sura</>?

20001418.text:
Yeah. Faithbearers are people that are bound by oath to the Sura. They are the ones who control the Hollows. 
Unlike the Sura, the Faithbearers disguise themselves as <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>normal people</>, so it's hard to find them.

20001419.text:
But you must be wary, as their power is no different from that of the Sura.
In particular, your Advocate power is their greatest desire.

20001421.text: It's important that you become stronger as quickly as possible. We should look for all the Caelite we can get our hands on...

20001424.text: You are? Hahaha! That's great! Well, what are you waiting for? Go on.

20001425.text: Are you done? What did you see this time?

20001429.text: I see... so that's why you are able to absorb Noi's Caelite. But that means Noi is...

20001430.text: Who killed Noi in the first place? Ugh... We need answers! Let's just ask <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Parsha</> about it!

20001431.text: How can we meet an Advocate?

20001432.text:
I don't know. Well, how about we go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Edeta Citadel</>? They worship Parsha there,
so they might know a way. We also need to tell them that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Harum</> is a Faithbearer.

20001434.text:
Uh, we need to head to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</>first. That's where the Edeta are located.
Let's go to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor</> and see if there's a boat sailing that way. We can plan what comes next after that.

20001436.text: All right! Shall we get going?

20001437.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>! I got us the ferry tickets!

20001440.text:
Oh, welcome aboard!
I'm Yang Daehe, the Captain of this ferry.

20001441.text:
You caught us just in time.
We just finished repairing our ferry that was damaged from the recent violent waves.

20001442.text: Now, now. I hope you've got your tickets?

20001443.text: I've got two tickets bound for Haewol.

20001446.text: Oh my... We're sorry, but it's just not possible right now...

20001448.text: Our ship was partially <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>damaged</> due to the recent violent <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>waves</>.

20001449.text: We'll be able to set sail after we fix our ship. Please wait until then.

20001450.text:
Ah! You guys look pretty desperate. 
If you're able to help us out and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>get the materials</> we need, we'll be able to set sail sooner!

20001451.text: (Finally I'm on the ship bound for <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</>.)

20001452.text: Do you have anything you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>need to wrap up</> before we set sail?

20001454.text: All right, if you're sure, let's set sail!

20001457.text: (Ah, it's a small <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Patron</>! Has it run away in fear? Let's go <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>inside</>.)

20001459.text: (I feel as though I might be sucked in.)

20001460.text: (A suspicious scroll is on rocky ground.)

20001461.text:
(The employees are talking among themselves.
I'll sneak up on them and eavesdrop.)

20001462.text: (These black stains lead behind the house.)

20001463.text: That was a very long time ago...

20001465.text: (Let's check whether I have all ten Hollow's Cores.)

20001466.text: (This is the New Fishbelly Pub. Let's find the Edeta encampment Harum talked about.)

20001471.text:
Oh, and it seems we're going to be traveling to all sorts of places.
We'd better jot down a record of our journey before we forget!

20001472.text: On the Map, you can also check how famous you are in this area.

20001473.text: There's a curious-looking monument over there.

20001474.text:
That must be the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Fable Monument</> recorded by the Elucidator Scholar.
Let's see what's written on it.

20001475.text:
You're the main culprit of the Martial Arts Championship incident, ho ho. Thank you for creating so much work for me.
Orum referred you to me, I see. You must have come for some information to help you on your journey.

20001476.text:
The longer you travel, the more things you find along the way, which weigh down your Bag or fill it to the brim.
When your load is overweight, you can't recover even if you rest. Please make a habit of checking your weight before you go on an adventure.

20001477.text: Please accept my apologies for what happened at the Martial Arts Championship.

20001478.text:
Oh, no worries.
It's been a while since I've worked this hard, so I actually enjoy it. Ho ho.

20001479.text: We Peach Blossom merchants can keep your surplus items for you.

20001480.text: You don't have to throw things away because your Bag is full. You can store them with us in case you might need them later.

20001481.text: We Peach Blossom merchants sell useful supplies, including technique tomes.

20001482.text: For your information, you need something called an Essence to improve the techniques you've learned.

20001483.text: Oh, and there are various shops in Moonwater Harbor. You should check them out when you have time.

20001484.text:
We meet again. I've heard you completed the Saho's request with flying colors.
Harum will be here soon.

20001485.text:
Ah, by the way, some of the Hollow's Cores include essences that can help improve your techniques.
Why don't you use them while waiting for Harum?

20001487.text:
I've heard a lot of things have happened since the Martial Arts Championship.
Don't you want to know how the other contenders are doing?

20001488.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, if you're frustrated because you're not as strong as the others around you,
I suggest you stop by the Soul Steel and Soul Bridge and find ways to become stronger.

20001489.text: You can't become strong without good gear.

20001490.text: I can teach you how to use the forge.

20001491.text: I came to learn how to grow strong from the Soul Bridge.

20001493.text: Have you heard of the Sword Secrets? They can make you even stronger, purr!

20001494.text: How do I get out of here?

20001495.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, let me be honest with you as the leader of the Plum Blossoms.
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, I don't think you're strong enough yet to find what you want in Haewol.

20001496.text: Why don't you gain more experience and further hone your skills here before you move on to that continent?

20001498.text:
It turned out that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> had done more bad deeds than we thought.
Help the Sapphire Basin clean up his mess, and that should give you ample experience.

20001501.text:
Hah... This is bad.
We don't have any catalysts to speed up the repairs, so it's going to take a while.

20001502.text: To steer a ship this size, I need a lot of power.

20001503.text:
The Monster Cores in the Destroyed Awakened Labyrinth are being used as catalysts for repairs.
But... our ship is so huge that we'll need a lot of them.

20001504.text: I'll go to the labyrinth and collect some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Monster's Cores</>.

20001505.text:
We don't want to burden you too much, though.
If you want, you can just train while you wait for the ship repairs to finish.

20001507.text: Wow, you really did it! Good job!

20001508.text: The repairs should be finished soon. You should get on board!

20001509.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, you came. You look so strong that I can barely recognize you.
You're done with this place now, aren't you?

20001511.text: Okay, then let's wait until the captain shows up.

20001512.text:
(I had a great time practicing my technique!
Since the repairs should be done by now, let's return to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Moonwater Harbor</>!)

20001514.text: While you record your journey, I'll take a look around the place.

20001516.text: (I've arrived at the entrance to the destroyed labyrinth.)

20001517.text:
There you are! It's a relief I've found you.
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>The Saho's speech</> is going to be held at the New Fishbelly Pub, and the Saho asked for your presence.

20001519.text:
They intend to reveal the truth about the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>strange occurrences</> that happened in the Sapphire Basin.
Since you were crucial in finding the culprit, we hope you can participate.

20001520.text:
But... We may need more time, since it's not completely ready.
What will you be doing while you wait?

20001521.text: I'll do some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>training</> and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>adventuring</> while I wait.

20001522.text:
I see. Please wait a while before you train or complete other quests.
We'll be even more grateful if you could help us while you wait.

20001523.text:
You've come just in time.
You seem to have gotten stronger.

20001524.text:
Now, the Saho's speech will commence shortly at the front platform.
Please come this way.

20001525.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Guardian Hongrin</>'s core in the deepest area of the labyrinth must have a lot of power...
But there's no way to obtain it.

20001526.text:
Come to think of it, you've grown much stronger than the first time I saw you.
I'll wait for you here.

20001527.text:
I don't think this is it.
Hm... Doesn't seem like <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Shiro's Caelite</> is here. Matter of fact, I don't see any Caelite here.

20001528.text:
Come to think of it, I never properly explained about Caelite to you, have I?
Caelite is... Simply put, it's the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Advocate's Energy</> materialized.

20001529.text:
Most people tend to mistake it as a normal gem, but
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Advocates</> or <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn Ones</> can draw immense power from it.

20001530.text:
The Reborn Ones also hold key memories of their life as an Advocate,
so when they absorb one, they remember a bit of their <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>past</>.

20001531.text:
The Reborn Ones can only absorb the Caelite which they left behind as an Advocate.
For me, that's Shiro's Caelite, the blue Caelite.

20001533.text:
Haha, not exactly. Caelite is treated like valuable gems.
That's why a lot of people hunt for it in the first place.

20001534.text:
And you might already know this, but in the case of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>the Sura</>,
they absorb the power of the Caelite, thereby extending their power and life.

20001535.text:
However, they are unable to absorb the Caelite itself.
That's why they usually try to wait for someone to unseal it and then ambush them.

20001536.text: I want to hear some more.

20001537.text:
My story must have been very amusing!
But for now, let's finish investigating this area first.

20001538.text:
I'm going to look below us. Can you look on the ridge above us?
And be careful, as the Protectors have become enraged.

20001540.text: I need to think about it... then I'll decide whether I'll obtain the Catalyst or keep training.

20001541.text:
Hey, you. Shouldn't you come running once you recognize someone? Hah?
Those stupid-looking brats never meet my expectations. Tsk, tsk.

20001542.text: Who do you think you are, acting so rude? And this waiting room is supposed to be off-limits.

20001543.text:
How dare you talk back!? There is no place in the Moonwater Plains where I, the owner <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>, can't go!
This is why I insisted that letting just anyone enter the tournament would only hurt its reputation.

20001544.text:
It's such a pity that some no-name got all the way to the finals.
The Saho are all talk and don't even understand what they're doing. Those idiots.

20001545.text:
Hey! Don't stand there like an idiot and drink this!
Huh? What is this, you ask? It's a nourishing tonic! A measly beggar like you can only dream of having this!

20001546.text:
Why are you so doubtful? Drinking this before the finals is a Fish Network tradition.
That white-haired guy over there drank some, too.

20001547.text:
(It's a suspicious-looking drink, but maybe I should have some. The final competitors have to drink it, after all.
Ugh, it smells and tastes weird... It's actually nauseating.)

20001548.text: (Ugh. The taste is just as bad as the smell. Any more, and I could throw up...)

20001549.text:
What's with that look on your face? You can't buy this nourishing tonic with money.
By the looks of it, you must be so poor that your body can't handle something so valuable.

20001550.text:
What are you just standing there for?
Run out and defeat that Aran or Aram whatever his name is before the tonic wears off!

20001551.text:
Actually, I've given it only to you, so you'd better win. I wagered quite a lot on you.
Then I'll get the better of the Saho with the money!

20001552.text: Now, let's go to the New Fishbelly Pub.

20001553.text: I should introduce you all first. I'm Mehwa, the Leader of the Plum Blossom.

20001554.text: This is Furlong, the Chief of the Soul Bridge.

20001555.text: And this is Horyong, the Owner of the Peach Blossom.

20001556.text: And lastly Moonwind, the Master of the Soul Steel.

20001557.text:
First, Furlong has something to request.
Let's hear him out.

20001558.text: Why did you come to gather herbs at this dangerous shipwreck?

20001559.text:
We only came here because of what <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> said!
That scawy <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> told us there's a large herb field at the shipwreck, meow! We've been scammed!

20001560.text: <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> again... Are the scrolls from the beach somehow related as well?

20001561.text:
Mrrow? This is <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>'s seal! Does this mean that the person who was supporting the Blueskins all this time was <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>?
I can't believe it! We need to bring this scroll to Furlong!

20001563.text: The man who handed me the suspicious drink in the waiting room is the same man who ran away from the house.

20001564.text:
Yes, I remember. I never received anything like that.
You were tricked into thinking that everybody who goes to the finals must drink it.

20001565.text: But why did he come out of this house? Where's the owner?

20001566.text:
That must be the misdelivered cargo that Hayon mentioned. But what's with those black spots?
Let's check out the black spots first.

20001567.text:
What are you talking about!? You should leave if you're finished with your job!
You brought what? What's that bottle?

20001568.text:
What? <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>'s mercenaries had the same smell as the smell in this bottle?
The ones who smelled like this were stronger than the others?

20001569.text:
Let's see... Sniff sniff... This is? It can't be! No, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> couldn't have plotted something so evil.
I'll take this drink for now. Well, I guess you did a good job, after all.

20001570.text:
You've obtained the Hollow's core. I was just experimenting on it at the Saho's request.
Wait a minute... Let's see if there's a reaction.

20001572.text:
Do you remember the suspicious nourishing tonic you left with the Soul Steel before?
I can't believe it, but the drink has the same components as a Hollow's core!

20001573.text:
But that means you drank this, and those other people drank it, too?
This is not good... How could he have a human drink something created from a Hollow!?

20001574.text:
I'll report this to the Saho.
I can't and don't want to believe such an atrocious act has been committed.

20001575.text: There's a huge problem! The disgraced <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> has disappeared without a trace!

20001576.text:
Well, he did create a drink from a Hollow's core...
And since we didn't know when he would cause even more problems, we were secretly spying on him.

20001577.text: He completely vanished while the Saho were away visiting Haewol.

20001578.text:
We haven't yet been able to search Soho Village and Creepy Valley,
so we request you to search the Creepy Valley for us.

20001579.text: I'll search the Soho Village area!

20001580.text: Ah! Here you are, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</>! Let's find out what he's up to.

20001581.text:
Hahahahahaha! There's no turning back for me!
I have nothing to lose now! Hahaha...

20001582.text:
I was in a bit of a hurry after you killed Steelfang,
but that actually worked out in my favor! Look at this! The magnificence of the tonic I've created myself!

20001583.text: Those measly Soho Villagers were just the beginning! If I can get this tonic into the water supply...

20001584.text: Then, everyone in the Moonwater Plains will be brainwashed into fighting for me! Hahahahaha!

20001587.text:
I'm sorry I'm late!
I was evacuating the people who just barely escaped Soho Village.

20001589.text: After a struggle, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Makara</> suffered in pain alone and then suddenly combusted.

20001590.text:
He was untrained, and yet placed his hands on a Hollow's core.
In the end, his body couldn't withstand it, and he succumbed to it.

20001591.text:
It's a very sad, pathetic way to die...
You should head back to the harbor first. I'll clean up this place before I return.

20001592.text:
Leave it to me!
Now, let's head to Turtle Lake!

20001593.text: (The craftsman seems to have more to say)

20001594.text:
This is <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>God's big gunshot</> here.
Here <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ereda Crew Doha< I mean, we just need to find</>, right?

20001595.text:
While you are looking for <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Doha</> and accepting the quest,
I'll take a look around this area.

20001596.text:
Oh, I think we'll be wandering around here and there, 
I'd better record our trip so we don't forget it!
